stanza.line: No Time thou shalt not boast that I dochange
Thy pyramids built up with newermight
To me are nothing novel nothingstrange
They are but dressings Of a formersight
Our dates are brief and therefore we admire
What thou dost foist upon us that isold
And rather make them born to our desire
Than think that we before have heard themtold
Thy registers and thee I bothdefy
Not wondring at the present nor the past
For thy records and what we see dothlie
Made more or less by thy continual haste
This I do vow and this shall everbe
I will be true despite thy scythe andthee
